AI_QUALITY_FAILURES.reasoning: ATLAS provided recommendations that appear generic and at least partially inconsistent with the configuration evidence in the same ticket, which risks misleading troubleshooting. In particular, ATLAS claimed an absence of a broad *.apple.com entry, while the later file analysis shows *.apple.com already present in the HTTPS exclusions group.
evidence: ATLAS (public): "Most relevant Apple CDN and update domains are included ... but there is no broad *.apple.com entry."
ATLAS FILE ANALYSIS (private): "Multiple Apple-related domains are included in the HTTPS exclusions IP address group: appldnld.apple.com, *.apple.com, apple.com, *.cdn-apple.com..."

AI_WALL_LOOPING.reasoning: The customer explicitly requested a technician to take a closer look and later escalated, indicating difficulty getting appropriate human/technical engagement. There is also evidence of prolonged back-and-forth with automated/templated guidance before L2 engagement.
evidence: Customer (private): "Could a technician from your team please take a closer look at this issue?"
Customer (private): "Given that the customer has been experiencing this problem for over a week now, could someone from your technical team please take a closer look at this case?"

IGNORING_CONTEXT.reasoning: Support guidance appears to repeat or contradict already-provided context/testing. The customer stated they already disabled HTTPS/HTTP inspection and later that they already tried the GRO change, yet the discussion continued to center on those suggestions without acknowledging that they had been attempted and failed.
evidence: Customer (private): "We have already disabled both the HTTPS Inspector and HTTP Inspector under Services, but unfortunately, that did not make any difference."
Jozef Kacala (public): "... disable GRO ... Apple devices do not 'understand' GRO ..."
Customer (private): "we already tried that. Unfortunately, it didn’t work."
ATLAS (public): "Action: Add *.apple.com to both your 'HTTPS exclusions'..."
ATLAS FILE ANALYSIS (private): "... HTTPS exclusions ... includes ... *.apple.com ..."

RESPONSE_DELAYS.reasoning: There are clear customer complaints about waiting with no concrete feedback, and the structured timeline indicates a very long resolution window. The ticket spans from mid-October to early November, with the customer explicitly noting a two-week gap.
evidence: Customer (private): "It has now been two weeks since our last communication, and unfortunately, we have not received any concrete feedback on the issue."

Although it was later reopened/continued, the initial duplicate-closure action occurred before resolving the customer’s access and issue.
evidence: Zubair Farooq (public): "This ticket is a duplicate of ticket# 60216786... We will close this ticket"
